Madam:

I have your letter of the 6th instant, regarding the refills which were forwarded for the 2 - 5 gallon fire extinguishers.

In reply I have to say that the Department understood, when placing the order, that these were Foamite fire extinguishers. It now appears they are Pyrene extinguishers, which use a different chemical from that in the Foamite extinguishers. We are today placing an order with the Pyrene Manufacturing Company Ltd., Toronto, to ship, addressed to you, recharges for 2 - 5 gallon Pyrene extinguishers. The above firm have been requested to forward their account to you in triplicate, F.O.B. Spanish. When these refills are received, you should certify on each copy of the account, as follows: "Goods received. Prices charged fair and just", and forward same to the Department for payment.

The Principal of the Boys' School has recently requested that refills for 2½ gallon extinguishers be supplied. If these are Foamite extinguishers, it is considered that the refills which you have on hand might be used in recharging these extinguishers. In any event, it will not be necessary for you to return these recharges. They should be kept on hand and could, no doubt, be utilized later in some of the extinguishers at either the Boys' or Girls' School.

I would request that, in future, when ordering recharges, it be stated definitely the type and name of the extinguishers for which recharges are required.

Your obedient servant,

Miss Louise Bonnot,
Girls' Indian Res. School,
Spanish, Ont.

A. P. MacKenzie,
Secretary.

Ottawa, August 29, 1932.

Reverend Sir:

I have your letter of the 19th instant, requesting that the Department supply, for the use of the Spanish Indian Residential School, 150 blankets, 18 mattresses, 4 bed springs and 4 bed heads.

In reply I have to say that it is regretted there are no funds to purchase this equipment. It will have to be supplied by the school authorities from per capita allowance or other receipts.

In December, 1931, the former Principal the Rev. Father Hewitt, purchased 50 blankets and the Department arranged with Ayers Limited, of Lachute, Que., to supply the blankets at the price they quote the Department. If it would be any advantage at the present time, we could arrange with Ayers Limited to quote you the same price for supplying the 150 blankets which you now require as they would do on blankets to this Department.

Your obedient servant,

A. F. MacKenzie,
Secretary.

Dear Sir,

On Dec. 2nd 1930 the school paid the Globe Furniture Co. $1064.75 for desks purchased. As per your letter No. 36-0-5 of August 13th 1930, signed Mr. A. F. It is noted you recommend that an Instant machine from your Hamilton factory - one that is identically the same as the Model "C" machine, with the exception that it is finished in Duco - be supplied. In view of your recommendation, the Department will approve of you supplying the type of extinguisher as made in your Hamilton factory, Duco finish, at the price quoted, viz., $28.70, complete with bracket and refill.

The account covering the cost should be forwarded, in triplicate, as requested in our letter of the 27th instant.

Your obedient servant,

A. F. MacKenzie,
Secretary.

CANADA
Dear Sir,

Miss St. James, the Superior of the Girls' Residential School of Spanish is very anxious to carry on the measures of protection against fire. She finds that some appliances are out of order and she asks me to solicit from the Department the following:

1. Two 50 ft fire hose, 2 inch, complete with fittings (style with nipple).
2. One New model C Instant Fire Extinguisher complete with chemical.
3. Fire Super Type Extinguisher, 1/2 quart, extinguisher complete with bracket and filled ready for use.

I think that these requests are reasonable and I recommend them to the kindness of the Department.

Yours sincerely,

Paul Mery

Indian Affairs. (RG 10, Volume 6218, file 471-5, part 3)
Ottawa, January 26, 1933.

Rev. Sir:

I have your letter of the 23rd instant, requesting to be supplied with fire hose and fire extinguishers for the use of the Girls' residential school at Spanish, Ont.

In this connection I have to inform you that an order is today being placed with Pyr-Fyter Products, 409 Keefer Building, Montreal, to forward, addressed to you, the following:

6 - 1½ Quart "Super" Pyr-Fyter Extinguishers, complete with bracket and filled ready for use.

It is considered that the Model "C" extinguishers asked for would be too heavy a type for use by the ladies in case of fire.

The above Company is being requested to forward to you their account, in triplicate, covering the cost, F.O.B. Spanish, Ont. When the extinguishers are received, if in good condition, please certify on each copy of the account as follows: "Goods received. Prices charged fair and just", sign and forward same to the Department, in order that payment can be made.

We are also placing an order with Gutta Percha & Rubber Limited, Ottawa, to ship, charges prepaid, addressed to you, the following:

2 Lengths unlined linen hose, 50 feet each, 2";
2 Sets water hose couplings, 2" shank;
2 Long brass nozzles, 2" x 10".

The account covering the cost of the fire hose and attachments will also be sent to you in triplicate, and you should certify the account in the same manner as requested above and send same to the Department, in order that payment can be made.

It is hoped when this equipment arrives that it will be satisfactory. The extinguishers should be distributed at strategic points throughout the girls' building.

Your obedient servant,

A. F. MacKenzie,
Secretary.

Rev. Paul Mary, S.J.,
Principal,
Indian Residential School,
Spanish, Ont.

Feb 28th, 1933.

The Secretary,
Department of Indian Affairs,
Ottawa.

Dear Sir,

I have now completed the new power pump and waterwork installations which were very necessary for both schools. Under the old arrangement we were often short of water, sometimes at most inconvenient times, e.g., on washing days. Moreover we have a greatly added help and security in case of fire. The cost has been approximately $366. as shown by these items:

Pump. Beatty Bros. $112.00
Motor Engine. Massey Harris. 134.00
Fittings. James Morrison Brass Mfg. Co. 81.00
Westco Pump Engineering Co. 14.00
Sundry fittings (circa). 25.00

$366.00

Both schools derive the greatest advantage from these improvements.

Can the Department give me any assistance towards this cost? As to how much I do not venture to make any suggestion, but I can assure you that whatever it may be, it will be very helpful in these hard times and I shall be duly grateful.

Yours very truly,

Paul Myers

Indian Affairs. (RG 10, Volume 6218, file 471-5, part 3)
Ottawa, March 3, 1933.

Rev. Sir:

I have your letter of the 25th ultimo, giving a statement of expenses incurred in completing the new power pump and waterworks installation at the Spanish Indian Residential School to an amount of $366, and requesting to be reimbursed for this outlay.

In reply I have to say that the Department has included an item in our Estimates for the coming fiscal year to cover the cost of this installation. Funds, however, will not be available until about the middle of April, next. If you will forward receipted accounts, in triplicate, certified by you on each copy of the account as follows: "Goods received. Prices charged fair and just", after the date mentioned, consideration will be given to reimbursing you for the expenditure incurred.

Your obedient servant,

A. F. MacKenzie,
Secretary.

Rev. Paul Nery, S.J.,
Principal,

Spanish, Ont.

Dear Sir,

I beg to thank you for your letter above quoted and to say how thankful I am that the Department is considering the reimbursement of this cost.

I have however, to send you an amended statement. The engineer, Mr. Jacoby, tells me to strike out the Water Pump Co $14.00 as this was for repairs on the old pump. Also to omit sundries $25.00 for these small items are scattered over several bills. It would cause Lewis Bros., rather more inconvenience to furnish receipts in triplicate than scare to cause them.

I have to add a bill from Messrs Thomas Robertson & Co., Montreal, which Mr. Jacoby forgot when giving me particulars.

The amended list now stands:

Pump Bently Bros. $112.00
Massey Harris 134.00
James Morrison Brass Mfg. Co. 81.25
Thomas Robertson Co. 96.41

$423.66

I have written to the above-named firms.
by this post for copies of receipt in triplicate.

yours very truly,

Paul Murray

Gentlemen,

Your obedient servant,

Indian Affairs. (RG 10, Volume 6218, file 471-5, part 3)
Ottawa, March 23rd, 1933.

Reverend Sir,

The Department is in receipt of your letter of the 10th instant, with reference to certain accounts which the Department agreed to consider paying. A cheque is being issued for $311.86, in payment of the Massey Harris, James Morrison Co., and Thos. Robertson & Co. accounts.

You did not forward any account for Beatty Bros., for the amount of $112.25. Instead, you sent the enclosed. Part of this is a credit note and is, therefore, being returned.

Your obedient servant,

A. F. MacKenzie,
Secretary.

Rev. P. Mery, S. J.,
Principal,
Indian Residential School,
Spanish, Ont.

Spanish
